mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: From corner, 10th and Oak Streets, looking southwest

The Oakland Museum is a three level concrete structure integrated with five acres of planting. Kiley's roof garden design "sets plants of varying textures and growing habits in compatible combinations, intertwined as green carpets." The plants complement and soften the rigid geometry of the building. (Process: Architecture, no. 33, p. 72) [work]
